item.title: The Multinational Corporation and the National Interest
item.description: Strange, Susan. “The Multinational Corporation and the National Interest.” In Decision Making in Britain, James Barber, editor. 165-178. Milton Keynes: Open University, 1972. In one of her earliest pieces to deal directly with multinational companies or corporations Strange argues that an analysis of the companies not only leads to both domestic and foreign policy making but also into the realm of international (regulatory) policy making. Much of the text is taken up with a discussion of the likely conflicts in interest between governments and corporations with multinational operations (as she prefers to term them).
